content: Another reason containers are not used in proof assistants is that the direct implementation isn't very efficient. Using a function to represent a small tuple is usually going to be worse, and involve more unnecessary recomputation, than just storing the values.

Thanks @Bob Atkey and @Jules Hedges , this makes sense. but I wish @Conor McBride would comment, as when this zulip started he seemed to have high hopes for the implementation of polynomials, if I understood correctly what he was saying then. (always a big if...)
